body:
I think of course people care about this.

If everyone decided to start telling me I'm a woman and using feminine pronouns for me, it would most certainly annoy me.

Is that not true for you? Would you be fine with everyone saying you're obviously a woman and they won't pretend otherwise?

body:
Depends on what 'woman' signifies. If the names are just switched, what's in a name? Who cares?

If being called a woman means a mandate to act a certain way, or wear certain clothes, or speak a in an airy voice, those people are seriously mistaken. But that's not the issue here. Nobody (parents don't count, that's a parenting issue, not a society issue) says a man isn't allowed to wear dresses, or drink fruity alcoholic beverages.People's perception of men who do, are irrelevant.
body_html:
Depends on what 'woman' signifies. If the names are just switched, what's in a name? Who cares?

If being called a woman means a mandate to act a certain way, or wear certain clothes, or speak a in an airy voice, those people are seriously mistaken. But that's not the issue here. Nobody (parents don't count, that's a parenting issue, not a society issue) says a man isn't allowed to wear dresses, or drink fruity alcoholic beverages.People's perception of men who do, are irrelevant.

body:
There are basically two schools of transexuals:

The ones who have some kind of next level homosexual BDSM fetish that includes genital mutilation

And the ones who believe the feminist bullshit about "male privilege" and "the patriarchy" and either want to distance themselves from male identity out of culturally imposed resentment, or get in on that sweet gravy train of unearned respect and admiration...

One is a psycho and the other is an idiot.

body:
What I find funny is that my mom has always had a deep voice. Always. 


For and ex. (not using real names though)
She used to get debt collector calls and they would ask for "larry" instead of Lauri. 


When she answered the phone, she never got pissed off about it, she just used it as a reason to tell them they had the wrong number 🤷

body: Supposedly the point is to casually identify with the other gender. But in practice most of them are neon-haired SJWs who do nothing but talk about how trans they are and how they need special privileges and how they're victims and everyone who doesn't do all these things for them is a BIGOT. You know, if you didn't scream "I'M TRANS VALIDATE ME!!!!" all the time, people wouldn't realize and "discriminate" against you in the first place (though I'm not convinced there's much discrimination regardless). And the made-up genders are also ridiculous, there are only two and that's completely obvious to anyone with half a brain, snowflake adjectives are not genders, they are adjectives. I think they're just looking for attention.

But in practice most of them are neon-haired SJWs who do nothing but talk about how trans they are and how they need special privileges and how they're victims and everyone who doesn't do all these things for them is a BIGOT. body: Not all of it is social. The brain is a sex-specific organ and male and female ones are wired and built completely differently. Some of it exists since birth or infancy, but most of it develops during puberty. Female is the default biologically, so this is why boys tend to lose their creativity and joyfulness, and to some extent their learning capacity, throughout adolescence while the women retain it. This happens because historically males needed to be good at strength, aggression, and spatial skills, so they trade in their talent in logic and creativity to specialize there. This is why men and women are so different. Unfortunately it's completely unfair, with almost everything bad being pinned on the men and the women hogging all the good things, with the exception of uterus pains. However until very recently it was essential; *someone* had to sacrifice their lives to do all the tough dirtywork no one wanted to do, and as men are the more expendable ones (one man can impregnate 10 women but 10 men and one woman can still only have 1 child) it naturally falls on them.
body_html: Not all of it is social. The brain is a sex-specific organ and male and female ones are wired and built completely differently. Some of it exists since birth or infancy, but most of it develops during puberty. Female is the default biologically, so this is why boys tend to lose their creativity and joyfulness, and to some extent their learning capacity, throughout adolescence while the women retain it. This happens because historically males needed to be good at strength, aggression, and spatial skills, so they trade in their talent in logic and creativity to specialize there. This is why men and women are so different. Unfortunately it's completely unfair, with almost everything bad being pinned on the men and the women hogging all the good things, with the exception of uterus pains. However until very recently it was essential; someone had to sacrifice their lives to do all the tough dirtywork no one wanted to do, and as men are the more expendable ones (one man can impregnate 10 women but 10 men and one woman can still only have 1 child) it naturally falls on them.

body:
We know it doesn't mean an actual mandate. You have freedom to behave any way you choose.

But I want people to perceive me as a man. Not as some butch lesbian with a deep voice and a goatee who drinks whiskey.

Does it actually matter? Not in any objective sense, I guess. But it matters to me.
body_html:
We know it doesn't mean an actual mandate. You have freedom to behave any way you choose.

But I want people to perceive me as a man. Not as some butch lesbian with a deep voice and a goatee who drinks whiskey.

Does it actually matter? Not in any objective sense, I guess. But it matters to me.

If being called a woman means a mandate to act a certain way, or wear certain clothes, or speak a in an airy voice, those people are seriously mistaken. But that's not the issue here. Nobody (parents don't count, that's a parenting issue, not a society issue) says a man isn't allowed to wear dresses, or drink fruity alcoholic beverages.People's perception of men who do, are irrelevant.

body:
As far as online goes, realistically speaking, if you aren't sharing images, you just need to correct someone and they'll almost always accommodate, as long as they remember. I've had plenty of experience with people mistaking me for a woman online while growing up, and its never been hard to correct.

As far as real life and images go, almost every trans person I've talked to agrees that if you're going to transition, you should try to pass - that if you don't put the effort in, you should at least try to be understanding of peoples' impressions. The problem is, as a whole, its not trans people speaking for themselves, its activists speaking for them.
body_html:
As far as online goes, realistically speaking, if you aren't sharing images, you just need to correct someone and they'll almost always accommodate, as long as they remember. I've had plenty of experience with people mistaking me for a woman online while growing up, and its never been hard to correct.

As far as real life and images go, almost every trans person I've talked to agrees that if you're going to transition, you should try to pass - that if you don't put the effort in, you should at least try to be understanding of peoples' impressions. The problem is, as a whole, its not trans people speaking for themselves, its activists speaking for them.

body:
Sure, we can agree you're a real jerk if you fly off the handle at a mistaken first impression or a simple slip of the tongue. If a person doesn't do anything intentionally malicious, don't get angry at them. Or at least don't let any anger show outwardly.

There are some trans people who will never, ever pass. Like Rachel Levine - no matter what she does, she'll never look a thing like a woman.

The OP argues that it doesn't matter if society sees her as a woman. Well, maybe it doesn't. But if society insists that she's a man, a fucking man, no question she's a man - well, of course she'll care. I'd care if society insisted that I'm a woman, a fucking woman, no question I'm a woman.

I bring light to dark places.

May you all see, and understand.

body:
>  male and female [brains] are wired and built completely differently

Oh hoh? And you know this because it's the common understanding, someone has told you, or because you understand the brain?

We know that hormones over time change the physical structure of the brain, but would a male brain on estrogen still be a male brain? Do you think that because of the chromosomes, it would still respond the way a 'male wired brain' would?

> boys tend to lose their creativity and joyfulness

Tend? If it's wired completely differently, then why isn't it *every* boy?

> they trade in their talent in logic and creativity

Interesting that the entire world of mathematics rests on the foundation of logic, and yet the majority of the foundation was laid by "uncreative" "unlogical" adult males... Crazy.

I'll stop with the cattyness here. You are making "common sense" assumptions that have been influenced not by careful understand and study of neural biology, but by your social upbringing. You repeat you assumptions as if they are fact, when you don't fully understand what you are talking about. There is so much wrong with your almost baseless claims I can't even begin to fully dissect it without writing a thesis paper. Please back up your claims with hard evidence or keep it to yourself.

male and female [brains] are wired and built completely differently

boys tend to lose their creativity and joyfulness

they trade in their talent in logic and creativity

Interesting that the entire world of mathematics rests on the foundation of logic, and yet the majority of the foundation was laid by "uncreative" "unlogical" adult males... Crazy.

I'll stop with the cattyness here. You are making "common sense" assumptions that have been influenced not by careful understand and study of neural biology, but by your social upbringing. You repeat you assumptions as if they are fact, when you don't fully understand what you are talking about. There is so much wrong with your almost baseless claims I can't even begin to fully dissect it without writing a thesis paper. Please back up your claims with hard evidence or keep it to yourself.

guild.name: UnpopularOpinion

parent.body: Not all of it is social. The brain is a sex-specific organ and male and female ones are wired and built completely differently. Some of it exists since birth or infancy, but most of it develops during puberty. Female is the default biologically, so this is why boys tend to lose their creativity and joyfulness, and to some extent their learning capacity, throughout adolescence while the women retain it. This happens because historically males needed to be good at strength, aggression, and spatial skills, so they trade in their talent in logic and creativity to specialize there. This is why men and women are so different. Unfortunately it's completely unfair, with almost everything bad being pinned on the men and the women hogging all the good things, with the exception of uterus pains. However until very recently it was essential; *someone* had to sacrifice their lives to do all the tough dirtywork no one wanted to do, and as men are the more expendable ones (one man can impregnate 10 women but 10 men and one woman can still only have 1 child) it naturally falls on them.

Female is the default biologically, so this is why boys tend to lose their creativity and joyfulness, and to some extent their learning capacity, throughout adolescence while the women retain it. This happens because historically males needed to be good at strength, aggression, and spatial skills, so they trade in their talent in logic and creativity to specialize there. This is why men and women are so different. Unfortunately it's completely unfair, with almost everything bad being pinned on the men and the women hogging all the good things, with the exception of uterus pains. However until very recently it was essential; someone had to sacrifice their lives to do all the tough dirtywork no one wanted to do, and as men are the more expendable ones (one man can impregnate 10 women but 10 men and one woman can still only have 1 child) it naturally falls on them.

body:
Fashion, yes. What clothing and mannerisms are seen as 'manly' or 'feminine' changes, based on society. 'Manly' is a social construct. Mind you, I'm not defending *every* trans group, but from my understanding, the majority of the trans movement, just poached 'man', and 'woman' to replace masculine and feminine. Not much different from Tomboy or Suzygirl. Why is a girl called a tomboy if she isn't a boy? Well, because she acts like one.

Gender roles were influenced by evolutionary necessity. If those natural inhibitors (pregnancy, body size, strength) were stripped away, do you think men and women are incapable of performing jobs in the same manner? If no, then the only answer left is gender roles are not a physiological function but an outcome of practicality. And evolutionary outcomes are all about practicality. 

I'm not defending the lunatics that say 'there's no biological difference between men and women, biology is irrelevant to sex', but I am saying, "Gender roles are **generally** irrelevant to sex. Except in reproduction." The shift in terminology from gender role to gender takes a bit of accustomization, but it isn't any different from any other large language change that's come before.
body_html:
Fashion, yes. What clothing and mannerisms are seen as 'manly' or 'feminine' changes, based on society. 'Manly' is a social construct. Mind you, I'm not defending every trans group, but from my understanding, the majority of the trans movement, just poached 'man', and 'woman' to replace masculine and feminine. Not much different from Tomboy or Suzygirl. Why is a girl called a tomboy if she isn't a boy? Well, because she acts like one.

Gender roles were influenced by evolutionary necessity. If those natural inhibitors (pregnancy, body size, strength) were stripped away, do you think men and women are incapable of performing jobs in the same manner? If no, then the only answer left is gender roles are not a physiological function but an outcome of practicality. And evolutionary outcomes are all about practicality.

I'm not defending the lunatics that say 'there's no biological difference between men and women, biology is irrelevant to sex', but I am saying, "Gender roles are generally irrelevant to sex. Except in reproduction." The shift in terminology from gender role to gender takes a bit of accustomization, but it isn't any different from any other large language change that's come before.

body:
> We know that hormones over time change the physical structure of the brain, but would a male brain on estrogen still be a male brain? Do you think that because of the chromosomes, it would still respond the way a 'male wired brain' would?

For the most part, yes. And estrogen does little to the brain (as female is the default state) and the effects of testosterone are irreversible. This is why it's basically impossible for trannies to go MtF, while FtM is barely noticeable.

There are some creative men but they are an anomaly. For the vast majority of people, your brain is structured by your sex, and studies have proven it to be completely different. Males specialize in physical/spatial skills and women specialize in thinking, which is perfectly utilitarian, just not fair.
body_html:
We know that hormones over time change the physical structure of the brain, but would a male brain on estrogen still be a male brain? Do you think that because of the chromosomes, it would still respond the way a 'male wired brain' would?

For the most part, yes. And estrogen does little to the brain (as female is the default state) and the effects of testosterone are irreversible. This is why it's basically impossible for trannies to go MtF, while FtM is barely noticeable.

There are some creative men but they are an anomaly. For the vast majority of people, your brain is structured by your sex, and studies have proven it to be completely different. Males specialize in physical/spatial skills and women specialize in thinking, which is perfectly utilitarian, just not fair.

parent.body:
>  male and female [brains] are wired and built completely differently

Oh hoh? And you know this because it's the common understanding, someone has told you, or because you understand the brain?

We know that hormones over time change the physical structure of the brain, but would a male brain on estrogen still be a male brain? Do you think that because of the chromosomes, it would still respond the way a 'male wired brain' would?

> boys tend to lose their creativity and joyfulness

Tend? If it's wired completely differently, then why isn't it *every* boy?

> they trade in their talent in logic and creativity

Interesting that the entire world of mathematics rests on the foundation of logic, and yet the majority of the foundation was laid by "uncreative" "unlogical" adult males... Crazy.

I'll stop with the cattyness here. You are making "common sense" assumptions that have been influenced not by careful understand and study of neural biology, but by your social upbringing. You repeat you assumptions as if they are fact, when you don't fully understand what you are talking about. There is so much wrong with your almost baseless claims I can't even begin to fully dissect it without writing a thesis paper. Please back up your claims with hard evidence or keep it to yourself.

body:
I don’t need other people to confirm who or what I am, which is the problem with these people because they are always seeking external validation.

The problem is people are going to think what they’re going to think. If someone doesn’t like or accept you, move on, it’s not a civil rights matter that someone doesn’t want to date you because you have a penis.
